pull_request.title: Better Beacon API evaluator part 1
pull_request.body:
**What type of PR is this?**

Tests

**What does this PR do? Why is it needed?**

This is the first of a series of PRs to make the Beacon API e2e evaluator more trustworthy. Currently it only tests a handful of GET endpoints.

I added GET endpoints for all sections except https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator. I also didn't implement reward endpoints which are inside the `Experimental` section, but might do it in the next PR.

IRREGULAR ENDPOINT OVERVIEW

A regular endpoint is an endpoint where we directly compare responses between Prysm and LH. This list contains endpoints where this is not the case.

- [/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlockV2) - in addition to regular comparison, we check if SSZ response is valid in `postEvaluation`
- [/eth/v1/beacon/blinded_blocks/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlindedBlock) - in addition to regular comparison, we check if SSZ response is valid in `postEvaluation`
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/attestations](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolAttestations) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH might have different atts in their respective pools
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/attester_slashings](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolAttesterSlashings) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/proposer_slashings](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolProposerSlashings) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/voluntary_exits](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolVoluntaryExits) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/bls_to_execution_changes](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolBLSToExecutionChanges) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/config/fork_schedule](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Config/getForkSchedule) - remove forks with far-future epoch set before comparing responses. Without this the evaluator fails because Prysm returns Deneb fork and LH doesn't.
- [/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/{state_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Debug/getStateV2) - this endpoint will be updated in the next PR, I left it as-is
- [/eth/v1/node/identity](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getNetworkIdentity) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH identity will be different
- [/eth/v1/node/peers](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeers) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH peers will be different
- [/eth/v1/node/peers/{peer_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeer) - this is executed in `postEvaluation`. We query for the first peer returned from `getPeers`.
- [/eth/v1/node/peer_count](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeerCount) - only check if response is not nil, although maybe peer count will always be the same?
- [/eth/v1/node/version](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getNodeVersion) - check if version response contains client name

UNIMPLEMENTED ENDPOINTS

- [/eth/v1/beacon/blob_sidecars/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlobSidecars) - Deneb-related
- all light client endpoints
- [/eth/v1/builder/states/{state_id}/expected_withdrawals](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Builder/getNextWithdrawals) - not supported by LH
- [/eth/v1/config/spec](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Config/getSpec) - Prysm and LH responses differ, but should theoretically be the same. After inspecting the resulting JSON values, it looks like both clients are missing some values. I am worried that it will be hard to maintain the response from this endpoint equal between clients. Maybe only check if it's not nil?
- [/eth/v1/debug/fork_choice](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Debug/getDebugForkChoice) - not supported by LH

OTHER

I sometimes see this error when trying to fetch the first Prysm peer in `postEvaluation`, not sure why:
> Evaluation failed for epoch 1: prysm request failed with response code: 500 with response body map[code:%!s(float64=500) message:Could not obtain ENR: could not serialize nil record]

pull_request.title: Better Beacon API evaluator part 1
pull_request.body:
**What type of PR is this?**

Tests

**What does this PR do? Why is it needed?**

This is the first of a series of PRs to make the Beacon API e2e evaluator more trustworthy. Currently it only tests a handful of GET endpoints.

I added GET endpoints for all sections except https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Validator. I also didn't implement reward endpoints which are inside the `Experimental` section, but might do it in the next PR.

IRREGULAR ENDPOINT OVERVIEW

A regular endpoint is an endpoint where we directly compare responses between Prysm and LH. This list contains endpoints where this is not the case.

- [/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlockV2) - in addition to regular comparison, we check if SSZ response is valid in `postEvaluation`
- [/eth/v1/beacon/blinded_blocks/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlindedBlock) - in addition to regular comparison, we check if SSZ response is valid in `postEvaluation`
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/attestations](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolAttestations) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH might have different atts in their respective pools
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/attester_slashings](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolAttesterSlashings) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/proposer_slashings](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolProposerSlashings) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/voluntary_exits](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolVoluntaryExits) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/beacon/pool/bls_to_execution_changes](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getPoolBLSToExecutionChanges) - same as above
- [/eth/v1/config/fork_schedule](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Config/getForkSchedule) - remove forks with far-future epoch set before comparing responses. Without this the evaluator fails because Prysm returns Deneb fork and LH doesn't.
- [/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/{state_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Debug/getStateV2) - this endpoint will be updated in the next PR, I left it as-is
- [/eth/v1/node/identity](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getNetworkIdentity) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH identity will be different
- [/eth/v1/node/peers](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeers) - only check if response is not nil because Prysm and LH peers will be different
- [/eth/v1/node/peers/{peer_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeer) - this is executed in `postEvaluation`. We query for the first peer returned from `getPeers`.
- [/eth/v1/node/peer_count](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getPeerCount) - only check if response is not nil, although maybe peer count will always be the same?
- [/eth/v1/node/version](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Node/getNodeVersion) - check if version response contains client name

UNIMPLEMENTED ENDPOINTS

- [/eth/v1/beacon/blob_sidecars/{block_id}](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/getBlobSidecars) - Deneb-related
- all light client endpoints
- [/eth/v1/builder/states/{state_id}/expected_withdrawals](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Builder/getNextWithdrawals) - not supported by LH
- [/eth/v1/config/spec](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Config/getSpec) - Prysm and LH responses differ, but should theoretically be the same. After inspecting the resulting JSON values, it looks like both clients are missing some values. I am worried that it will be hard to maintain the response from this endpoint equal between clients. Maybe only check if it's not nil?
- [/eth/v1/debug/fork_choice](https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Debug/getDebugForkChoice) - not supported by LH

OTHER

I sometimes see this error when trying to fetch the first Prysm peer in `postEvaluation`, not sure why:
> Evaluation failed for epoch 1: prysm request failed with response code: 500 with response body map[code:%!s(float64=500) message:Could not obtain ENR: could not serialize nil record]

pull_request.title: Update Spectests Along With Go-ethereum
pull_request.body:
**What type of PR is this?**

Spec Update

**What does this PR do? Why is it needed?**

This PR is built on #13090, it updates our spectest to the latest version which adds in support for the changed minimal trusted setup config. This makes both the mainnet and minimal trusted setups the same unblocking E2E testing in minimal. 

This PR also updates our go-ethereum commit to take advantage of the  KZG library supporting this new minimal config.

**Which issues(s) does this PR fix?**

Supersedes #13090

**Other notes for review**

issue.title: Add a Generate Genesis State Command to Prysmctl

labels.name: Ready For Review
labels.description: A pull request ready for code review

labels.name: OK to merge
labels.description: Bulldozer will merge this if approved and all checks pass

labels.name: Cleanup
labels.description: Code health!

labels.name: Tools
labels.description: Tools related tasks

issue.body:
As part of making Prysm easy to use for running a local devnet, it would be ideal if the tool for generating a genesis state can live under the prysmctl binary, which we are increasingly building to be a really great CLI tool for all things related to Prysm. This will be published as a Docker image under our GCR and will make instructions trivial. This is a refactor of the tool that already existed under tools/genesis-state-gen, but written with cleaner code and smaller functions.

Usage is:

```
NAME:
   prysmctl testnet generate-genesis - Generate a beacon chain genesis state from specified configs

USAGE:
   prysmctl testnet generate-genesis [command options] [arguments...]

OPTIONS:
   --chain-config-file value  The path to a YAML file with chain config values
   --config-name value        Config kind to be used for generating the genesis state. Default: mainnet. Options include mainnet, interop, minimal, prater, ropsten, sepolia. --chain-config-file will override this flag. (default: "mainnet")
   --deposit-json-file value  Path to deposit_data.json file generated by the staking-deposit-cli tool for optionally specifying validators in genesis state
   --genesis-time value       Unix timestamp seconds used as the genesis time in the genesis state. If unset, defaults to now() (default: 0)
   --num-validators value     Number of validators to deterministically generate in the genesis state (default: 0)
   --output-json value        Output filename of the JSON marshaling of the generated genesis state
   --output-ssz value         Output filename of the SSZ marshaling of the generated genesis state
   --output-yaml value        Output filename of the YAML marshaling of the generated genesis state

```

pull_request.title: Check blob index duplication for blob notifier
pull_request.body: Ensure the blob index is not duplicated before sending it to the blob notifier. This resolves an issue observed in devnet10. The trigger involves writing the blobs to a specific channel and subsequently calling `ReceiveBlock` within the same goroutine.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +94,49 @@ var ErrMissingClockSetter = errors.New("blockchain Service initialized without a
 type blobNotifierMap struct {
 	sync.RWMutex
 	notifiers map[[32]byte]chan uint64
+	seenIndex map[[32]byte]*[fieldparams.MaxBlobsPerBlock]bool
comment.body:
I was thinking reference is more straightforward than copy. like:
```
seenIndices := bn.seenIndex[root]
seenIndices[idx] = true
```

If it's not a pointer then I have to assign it back right?
